text:
Sander "Sandy" Vanocur (; born Alexander Vinocur, January 8, 1928 – September 16, 2019) was an American television journalist and actor. He was born in Cleveland, Ohio. He focused on national electoral politics. After leaving NBC in 1971, Vanocur worked for PBS and as a television writer for "The Washington Post". He joined ABC News in 1977 and worked there until 1991.
Vanocur hosted two of the History Channel's primetime series: "Movies in Time" and "History's Business". His work at NBC earned him a place on the Nixon administration's "enemies list". He played himself in the 1994 television movie "Without Warning".
Vanocur died in Santa Barbara, California on September 16, 2019 from dementia-related problems at the age of 91.
